instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: the magsafe doesn't light up and doesn't charge the battery except if you disconnect the battery once, any ideas?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: The usual suspects, IO board on flat cable?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: Thx, the IO Board & Flat Cable are new, any other ideas?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: 3V42 getting to the IO board? Inspect connector on the board too for corrosion. Was this liquid?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: Yes it was liquid, yes IO Board an Voltage ok.

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: "ok" is not a measurement. What is voltage on center pin of magsafe connector with adapter connected?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: Hi, the center pin Voltage is 3,4 when Battery is disconnected. Battery Connected Voltage is 0,2 on Center pin and 6,6V on + Pins.

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: That does not make a lot of sense. I see no reason for the one wire to go to 0.2V when a battery is connected. Is ACOK signal staying high? Is PPBUS 8.6V without battery?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A Charging problems
threads.message: Thats what I say, it doesn't make any Sense... but when the Battery is disconnected everything works fine, reconnect the battery charges the battery. Then disconnect the Magsafe and reconnect it there no charging activity. I will check the other voltages and give u a feedback.
